text: William Paul (7 February 1866 – 23 October 1911) was a Scottish footballer who played for Partick Thistle and Scotland as a centre forward. He was capped three times by Scotland and scored five goals (including four in one match in 1890). He featured for Partick Thistle across three decades, with his statistics in competitive matches for the club standing at 127 goals in 218 appearances. == Personal life == Paul also worked as a shipwright at the Glasgow dockyards. He died in 1911, at age 45, from an appendix-related ailment. He was buried in the Western Necropolis in Maryhill. == References == ==External links== * *International goals at Londonhearts.com *IFFHS Category:Scottish footballers Category:Scotland international footballers Category:Scottish Football League players Category:Partick Thistle F.C. players Category:Queen's Park F.C. players Category:1911 deaths Category:1869 births Category:Footballers from Glasgow Category:Association football forwards Category:People from Partick
title: Willie Paul (footballer)
